item.title: Someone Is Trying To Auction Off A Cheeto Shaped Like The Atari Logo On eBay
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! I‚Äôm in a bad mood today. Don‚Äôt talk to me. Yeah, whatever, welcome to Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äòs daily round-up of news and other stuff you might care about.  Just read this post about the Witcher author being upset about the games changing his lore and some other stuff, and then leave me alone. I‚Äôm going back to my room. Don‚Äôt bug me.

How Much Would You Pay For An Atari-Shaped Cheeto?

Over on eBay, a person is trying to auction off a Cheeto they claim to have found in a bag that kind of looks like the Atari logo. The seller is also offering the Cheeto for the buy-now price of $10,000. ‚ÄúWhat can I say? It‚Äôs the ultimate showpiece for the ultimate Atari fan,‚Äù is how the seller describes this item on the website. They then explain ‚Äúin all seriousness‚Äù that some ‚Äúweird stuff‚Äù is happening in their life right now, and extra money would be a ‚Äúhuge blessing to me and my family.‚Äù

The seller also claims that they have been a part of the Atari homebrew community for a while now and even published and co-designed a few games. Oh, and they were also a professional wrestler. Wild stuff. All of this might explain why they add in that, if requested, they‚Äôll even sign the Atari-shaped Cheeto piece, too.  ‚ÄúHappy bidding,‚Äù is how the seller ends the Cheeto‚Äôs listing. Nobody has placed a bid as of 9:30 a.m. EST on October 1.

There Aren‚Äôt Actually Multiple Witcher Schools, Says Creator Of The Series

You know how in the Witcher games there are multiple ‚ÄúWitcher Schools‚Äù? Geralt, for example, is from the School of the Wolf. And the Witcher 4 teaser included a look at the medallion for the School of the Lynx. There are others, too, in the universe of the games. But according to the author behind the OG Witcher books, Andrzej Sapkowski, all of that is hogwash based on a single sentence that shouldn‚Äôt have been included at all.

‚ÄúA single sentence about some ‚Äòschool of the Wolf‚Äô mysteriously made its way into The Last Wish,‚Äù Sapkowski explained in a Reddit AMA spotted by PC Gamer. ‚ÄúI later deemed it unworthy of development and narratively incorrect, even detrimental to the plot. Therefore, later, I never included or referenced any Witcher Gryffindors or Slytherins again. Never. However, that one sentence was enough. Adaptors, particularly videogame people, have clung to the idea with remarkable tenacity and have wonderfully multiplied these ‚Äòwitcher schools.‚Äô Completely unnecessary.‚Äù

As for what happens now, Sapkowski says he might expand on the concept in future stories, or he might just have his publisher remove the sentence from future copies of the book. Either way, it‚Äôs safe to say the games are doing their own thing compared to the books, which is fine. Adaptations don‚Äôt need to be carbon copies of the original work to be worthwhile.

We‚Äôll Learn More About The Future Of Halo Later This Month

Last October, Halo Studios (formerly 343 Industries) and Xbox unveiled the first look at the future of Halo games during the franchise‚Äôs annual esports tournament, the Halo World Cup aka Halo WC. Well, after teasing it earlier this year, Xbox has confirmed one again that they‚Äôll have more to share about the future of Halo, which is likely to be built in Unreal Engine, at this year‚Äôs upcoming Halo WC.

‚ÄúLike last year, we‚Äôll be on the Main Stage to talk about it, but this year we‚Äôve also got a deep dive panel planned for the Community Stage that you won‚Äôt want to miss,‚Äù explained Halo eSports lead Tashi on the official Halo website. We‚Äôll likely get a new trailer and maybe even some early gameplay footage of the next Halo game. The Halo WC takes place from October 24 to October 26.

Prototype Might Be Getting A Remaster Or Something

Remember Prototype, that open-world anti-superhero action game from Activision released back in the Xbox 360 era? Probably not, but if you do remember it and were wondering what‚Äôs up with Prototype, well, dataminers have dug up evidence that the game might be getting a full remaster or at least a cleaned-up re-release of sorts over 15 years after launch.  As reported by IGN, the game has received numerous behind-the-scenes updates on Steam, and it looks like Iron Galaxy, a studio known for remastering games, is now included in the game‚Äôs credits. Interesting stuff‚Ä¶for people who miss Prototype.

ICYMI: 

  • Capcom wants to lock SF6 finals behind a paywall
  • Black Ops 7 wants cheaters to come cheat in the beta
  • Overwatch 2 fans want a Junkrat skin that puts him in a diaper

Watch This:

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy And Every Other Game Added To Game Pass In The Big Shakeup
item.content:encoded:
News

Hogwarts Legacy And Every Other Game Added To Game Pass In The Big Shakeup

Over 80 games have been added across various tiers of Game Pass with its big price hike

Game PassHogwarts LegacyXbox

Microsoft is adding a bunch of games to Xbox Game Pass to make Wednesday‚Äôs massive price hike announcement sting a little less. Hogwarts Legacy is the big one being added to all tiers of the program. Of the more than 80 games joining across different tiers, many are Ubisoft Classics, including Assassins Creed: Black Flag and Far Cry 3. A ton are also PC-only games, so if you only own an Xbox Series X/S, I‚Äôm not sure what exactly you‚Äôre supposed to do with those. Some of them will run on anything, like the original Fallout. Others, like the hit medieval settlement sim Manor Lords, will not.

Here‚Äôs the complete list of every game added to Game Pass on October 1, 2025:

Ultimate ‚Äì Available Today (now $30 a month)

  • Hogwarts Legacy (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed II (PC)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed III Remastered (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed IV Black Flag (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed IV Black Flag: Freedom Cry (PC)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed Brotherhood (PC)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed Chronicles: China (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed Chronicles: India (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed Chronicles: Russia (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Assassin‚Äôs Creed Liberation HD (PC)

  • Far Cry 3 (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Far Cry Primal (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Hungry Shark World (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Monopoly Madness (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Monopoly 2024 (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • OddBallers (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown (Cloud, PC, and Console)

  • The Crew 2 (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • The Settlers: New Allies (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Tom Clancy‚Äôs Ghost Recon Breakpoint (Cloud, PC, and Console)

  • Trackmania Turbo (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Transference (Cloud and Console)
  • Trials Fusion (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Trials of the Blood Dragon (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Trials Rising (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Uno (Cloud, PC, and Console)

  • Watch_Dogs (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Wheel of Fortune (Cloud and Console)
  • Zombi (Cloud, PC, and Console)

Premium ‚Äì Available Today (also in Ultimate)

  • 9 Kings (Game Preview) (PC)
  • Abiotic Factor (Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X|S)
  • Against the Storm (Cloud, PC, and Console)
  • Age of Empires: Definitive Edition (PC)

  • Diablo (PC)
  • Diablo IV (PC and Console)
